title: Derby's Tom Lawrence and Mason Bennett fined six weeks wages following drink-drive crash
text:
Derby have released a statement after completing the disciplinary hearing regarding Tom Lawrence and Mason Bennett following their drink-drive crash last week.

On Friday night, the Championship outfit confirmed that the Derby duo, who are due in court on October 15, will be fined six weeks wages and will serve an additional 80 hours of community and rehabilitation work, which will include a drink aware course.

The crash left Richard Keogh's career hanging in the balance, having been ruled out until December next year after suffering two ruptured ligaments.

Tom Lawrence and Mason Bennett have been fined the equivalent of six weeks wages

On learning his punishment, Bennett wrote a statement on Derby's website, claiming he is 'ashamed'.

The Derby forward said: 'On the night of Tuesday 24th September, I made huge mistakes after consuming alcohol. What I did was wrong.

'Being a footballer and someone who young fans look up to I know the example I set is key. I am ashamed.

Richard Keogh has been ruled out for 15 months after being involved in the car crash last week

'At 23 I am old enough, and I was brought up, to know better.

'I understand that such actions have serious consequences. I take full responsibility for my actions and accept the punishment that the club has issued.

'I have to and will learn from these events and will strive to be a better person.

'There's no excuse for what I've done. I'm sorry to my family, my friends, the club, all Derby supporters and to the wider football community, I let you all down.'
description: Derby have released a statement after completing the disciplinary hearing regarding Tom Lawrence and Mason Bennett following their drink-drive crash last week.
